mca.books.death.author: Ozzie the Warrior
mca.books.death.0: §fI couldn't count how many times my family has been blown to pieces by creepers. How are they still around, you may ask? Easy! I, dear reader, have discovered a cure for death itself! And through this book, I can share it with you
mca.books.death.1:
§f§lGraves§r§f
§r§fWhen a family member dies, his corpse is buried in the nearest grave.
mca.books.death.2: §f§lStaff Of Life§r§fThe Staff is a powerful item that can revive up to 5 people. Place a memorial item on the ground and wave the staff over it. Within moments, your loved one will be fully revived!§r§f
mca.books.death.3:
§f§lSummoning Grim§r§f
Unfortunately, you must obtain the Staff from the Grim Reaper himself. To summon him, you must build an altar consisting of 3 obsidian columns that are at least 2 blocks high. They may be higher if you like.
mca.books.death.4:
§f§lSummoning Grim 2§r§f
Build altar. Obsidian and stuff. Fire. Grimreaper goes brrt.
mca.books.death.5:
§f§lSummoning Grim 3§r§f
After building the altar, wait until night and light all 3 columns. When you're ready to fight, light the emerald block and run!
mca.books.death.6:
§f§lFighting Grim§r§f
Grim is tough. Use full diamond armor, lots of potions, and lots of enchantments. He can:
- Fly
- Block attacks
- Blind you
- Move your items
- Teleport
mca.books.death.7:
§f§lFighting Grim 2§r§f
If you hit Grim while he's blocking, he will teleport behind you and strike. Do not try to use arrows or poison, he is immune!§r§f
mca.books.death.8:
§f§lFighting Grim 3§r§f
When Grim is at §lhalf health§r§f he will teleport into the air and begin healing. While healing, he will summon his minions from the underworld to fight you.
mca.books.death.9:
§f§lFighting Grim 4§r§f
When Grim is healed, he will continue attacking you, but he won't be able to heal again for 3 minutes and 30 seconds. Each time Grim heals, he will not be able to restore as much health has he did previously.
mca.books.romance.author: Gerry the Librarian
mca.books.romance.0:
§lIntroduction§r
Interaction is key to building relationships and finding the love of your life. I've happily written this book in order to share my knowledge of interaction, love, and, unfortunately, divorce, to anyone who may need a little push in the right direction.
mca.books.romance.1:
§lPersonalities§r
When speaking to any villager, you'll notice they have a personality. Pay close attention to this. I have outlined each personality's quirks here. Each personality has a particular category they fall into (1-3).
mca.books.romance.2:
§lPersonalities 2 §l
Athletic (2): Runs faster §lConfident (3): Hits harder §lStrong (3): Doubled attack damage §lFriendly (1): Gains hearts faster §lCurious (2): Finds more when working §lPeaceful (1): Will not fight
mca.books.romance.3:
§lPersonalities 3 §l
Flirty (2): Bonus to all interactions §lWitty (2): Appreciates jokes §lSensitive (1): Easily offended §lGreedy (3): Finds less when working §lStubborn (3): Harder to gain hearts §lOdd (2): N/A
mca.books.romance.4:
§lPersonalities 4
The category shows what a person likes more than others: §l1:Chatting, Stories §l2:Joking, Romance §l3:Chatting, Shake Hand, Stories§rIn the case of personality type 3, it is not recommended to attempt jokes or romantic interactions.
mca.books.romance.5:
§lMoods
Every person has a mood, which is always apparent when speaking to them. Moods can change throughout the day, and determine how likely a villager is to like your interaction, and how many hearts you'll gain.
mca.books.romance.6:
§lMoods 2
Villagers in a good mood may have a certain 'glow' about them, and will be easier to interact with. Villagers in a bad mood may cry, or be visibly angry and be more difficult to interact with.
mca.books.romance.7:
§lMoods 3
The death of a villager seems to put those nearby in bad moods. Taxing also gradually decreases the moods of everyone nearby. Gifts and successful interactions are known to boost moods.
mca.books.romance.8:
§lInteracting
Choose wisely when interacting with a villager, based on their mood and personality!§rIf choosing a romantic interaction, be sure that the villager you are talking to likes you a lot.
mca.books.romance.9:
§lInteracting pt. 2
Don't be annoying! Talking to someone for too long will bore them, and your interactions may stop succeeding. If this happens, simply wait a few minutes before trying to talk to them again.
mca.books.romance.10:
§lMarriage
To get married, simply gift a villager a wedding ring once you feel you have reached the highest relationship level. If you have a lot of friends in the village, you may want to get engaged first!
mca.books.romance.11:
§lEngagement
Gift an engagement ring before gifting a wedding ring. All nearby villagers will give you gifts when you get married, but only if you're engaged first!§rVillagers that like you more will give you better gifts.
mca.books.romance.12:
§lDivorce
Unfortunately, sometimes it is best to split from your spouse and move on. To do this, you may craft divorce papers with paper, a feather, and ink. Gift them to your spouse and the marriage will end. They will not be happy!
mca.books.family.author: Leanne the Cleric
mca.books.family.0: Children, are our future! Make sure to have as many as you possibly can.§rNot only do you get to experience the joy of raising a child, but once they are past the baby stage, put them to work!
mca.books.family.1:
§lBabies§r
When you are married, simply approach your spouse and offer to 'Procreate'. After a short dance, you'll be the proud owner of a new baby boy or girl (or maybe even both)!
mca.books.family.2:
§lGrowth§r
Babies take time to grow, make sure to hold them until they are ready, or give them to your spouse to take care of. Once a baby is ready to grow, you may place it on the ground and it will grow into a child!
mca.books.family.3:
§lAdolescence§r
Children will grow slowly from age 4 to 18.§rHowever, the magical properties of Golden Apples are said to accelerate any child's growth. I have yet to try this myself.
mca.books.family.4:
§lChores§r
Any child can farm, cut wood, mine, hunt, and fish. You'll need to provide them with the tools they need to do so. If a tool breaks and the child doesn't have another, they will have no choice but to stop working.
mca.books.family.5:
§lGreed§r
If you notice your child has a Greedy personality, be careful!§rGreedy children are known to steal away items that they may pick up while doing chores.
mca.books.family.6:
§lMining§r
A special note on Mining here, most children have a peculiar ability to search for and locate ores underground. This activity damages any pickaxe they may have in their inventory.
mca.books.family.7:
§lAdulthood§r
As sad as it may be, children will eventually grow into adults. Once they are adults, they will no longer work for you. Adults can be married off by using Matchmaker's Rings, or they will eventually get married on their own.
mca.books.rose_gold.author: William the Miner
mca.books.rose_gold.0:
§lWarning!
TOP SECRET§rThis manual is the property of William Mining Co.§rIf you are not a William Mining Co. employee, please refrain from reading this manual and return promptly to William the Miner.
mca.books.rose_gold.1: Ah, rose gold - a lovely combination of silver, copper, and gold that smelts into a pinkish orange metal. Most use it as an alternative to gold for crafting rings as it is much less expensive. However, it has some interesting qualities that are easy to miss.
mca.books.rose_gold.2:
§lCreating Dust§r
Rose gold, once smelted, can be crushed into a fine dust. Look closely at rose gold dust in bright light, and you'll see shiny flecks of pure gold!§r
mca.books.rose_gold.3:
§lWashing Dust§r
With a little work, we can actually extract the gold from the dust and create pure gold ingots. Simply mix dust with a bucket of water. The lighter silver and copper components will wash away, leaving you with about 6 smaller piles of gold dust.
mca.books.rose_gold.4:
§lExtracting Gold§r
Arrange 9 piles of dust on your crafting table, and if you're lucky, you'll find a gold nugget in one of them!§rAnd of course, once you have 9 gold nuggets, you'll be able to craft them into a solid gold ingot.
mca.books.infection.author: Richard the Zombie
mca.books.infection.0: Good, day, readers! I've written this book so that you may not end up suffering the same fate as I. Although I caught the infection, I was luckily able to keep all of my mental faculties.
mca.books.infection.1:
§lWhat is the Infection?§r
I discovered long ago that the zombies that appear at night are actually villagers in the late stages of infection!§rNewly infected villagers turn green, are unable to speak, and occasionally try to bite!
mca.books.infection.2:
§lCuring§r
Contrary to popular belief, any infected villager can be cured. You must first weaken the villager or zombie with a potion. Then, immediately feed them a golden apple.
mca.books.infection.3:
§lCuring 2§r
Zombies that can be cured often have enlarged heads and noses. Any other zombies you see unfortunately are too far gone, and cannot be cured.
mca.books.infection.4:
§lCuring 3§r
Zombies will take a couple of minutes to be fully cured. Villagers who were recently infected, though, and haven't had time to degrade into a full zombie, will be cured instantly!
mca.books.infection.5:
§lWarnings§r
Villagers are highly susceptible to infection, and children even more so!§rIf you carry a baby with you while fighting zombies, there is a chance it can become infected.
